turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alex. Ohh. Hello? Hi, can you hear me?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK great. Um how can I help you this morning, sir?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Alright, so I've been feeling, I've been feeling kind of uh under the weather for the past four days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um it started with the um, uh sore throat and runny nose, and

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It's sort of, um, it's sort of going into a cough now. Um, the sort throat is kind of going away, but, um, <UNIN/> I'm starting to cough.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm-hmm. OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And uh <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> kind of uh bad and tired.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sorry to hear that <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm. OK. I'm sorry to hear that. Seems like there's a lot going on there. Um so let's start with your, your sore throat first. Um <UNIN/> tell me a bit more about that, if you can.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um ,so I, I <UNIN/>, you know I think I, it all started with, uh, this colleague of mine, she just kept sneezing next to me, all the time. I think her kids are catching something from the

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: uh from their kindergarten or something. And uh, you know the it it started as normal sore throat, and uh was quite painful for a couple days, but then it was past.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. OK. And did you have any uh difficulty or pain on swallowing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um yeah. Yeah it was uh, it was quite painful to swallow, <UNIN/> for one or two days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You <UNIN/>, did you manage to have a look at the back of your throat in the mirror?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um no, not really.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No. OK you didn't, you didn't notice any abnormal <UNIN/> white spots, redness at the back of your throat?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No. Um I I didn't think about uh <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> that's OK. That's OK. And you mentioned a runny nose. Um again what kind of discharge is coming out? Is it clear, or is it <UNIN/> a bit more coloured?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah yeah, it's uh it's <UNSURE>clearing up</UNSURE> <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sort of um, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> sort of getting my nose stuffed all the time. It's very had to, uh to get it free.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. You feel quite congested, do you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, quite congested.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fine. Um you also mentioned a cough as well. Can you tell me a bit more about that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um yeah that started recently, like just uh um maybe yesterday. And um it's uh, it's dry for now, it's it's not very painful but it's sort of there, all the time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And is it worse any particular time of the day?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sorry?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is it, is it worse any particular time of the day? For example in the evenings, night time, mornings?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> throughout the day.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No it's it's um, it's sort of, it's sort of constant. Um I forgot to mention, that um I'm also having uh night sweats.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Night first, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>That's</UNSURE>, that's very odd actually. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> makes me a bit tired, um makes my <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> uneasy.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I can imagine, yes. Uh and this has again, been going on for last uh three four days, has it?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um right, OK. Have you noticed any fevers or temperatures at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um I I had some some fever in the beginning, but it's now sort of uh going down. I I've been taking some Paracetamol and Ibuprofen for that, and uh they, they help.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's very sensible. Um very good. Um in terms of your chest otherwise, have you any difficulty breathing, or any pain in your chest?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um so no pain in chest, but uh I noticed that I um um so I feel a bit winded on exertion. So if I I <UNIN/> I haven't been going, going to the gym thus uh, because of that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: When you say winded, do you feel, uh do you feel more short of breath would you say, on exertion? Is that when you, OK. Um and and that's mainly on exercise. But when you're resting, there's no problem.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> yeah. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. When when when I'm resting it's OK. So <UNIN/> I've been actually going to work, um sort of managing.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fine. Just a couple other questions <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, if you don't mind. Any pain in, in your ears at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, you don't feel blocked, or any discharge coming out of your ears?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I don't think so.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fine. Um what I'm gonna do, I'm just gonna run through a few uh yes no questions, if you if you don't mind, just a review of your systems. Any, any headaches at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah, yeah. That that's still, that's still there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Whereabouts are the head, headaches?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um it's sort of general. Uh and uh <UNIN/> they're not, they're not always there, but you know every now and then they will come and go.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And with those headaches have you had any problems with your, with your eyesight, your vision?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh any difficulty with seeing bright lights?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I don't think so.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Um and just moving down now, <UNIN/> in terms of any, any feeling nausea or any vomiting?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, none of that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Tell me about your bowels. Are your bowels working OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh yeah, yeah. Think so.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You're passing urine OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How's your appetite, sir?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah I've been, I've been drinking a lot more than the usual. But uh so <UNIN/> other than that, so <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um and you're eating and drinking, uh you're eating OK otherwise.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um maybe a bit less than uh than what I, I would usually have.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um have you noticed any, any funny rashes at all, on your skin?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um no, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No. And any general muscle pain or aches, joint pain, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. Yeah that's, that sort of started in the past couple days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, OK. Alright um and uh just having a look at the rest of your history, are you otherwise fit and well? Or do you have any other medical problems I should be aware of?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so otherwise that, uh, I'm I'm fine. There's um, there isn't anything that I'm taking or, I'm being treated for.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Um</UNSURE>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So you are otherwise fit and well. Uh any, any allergies at all to any medications, I should be aware of?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Any family history at all? So anything relevant in the family that I should be aware of? Anything like diabetes, high blood pressure?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah my grandma has diabetes. Um, and, my grandma.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Your brother?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> you say grandma, sorry my apologies. Grandma, OK. Uh do you know what type of diabetes it is? Is it type one, type two?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I think <UNIN/>, I think it's type two.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um anything else which you think is significant?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I, I think um, one of my uh, great grandads had an eczema.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Excellent, OK. OK. Um just moving on to what we <UNIN/> social history, just to get to know you a bit more as a person. Tell me, who do you live with at home?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh um, I live alone.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And you said you're working at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What do you do for work?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm an, I'm an accountant.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and how's your work going at the moment? Uh over the last, has it, has it been affecting your work?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, a little bit. I've been a bit slower. And you know, it's uh, it's, it's a bit of a stressful period just around the um, end of the year. Right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm, OK. Is that stress, is that affecting your um, your mood at all any, in any way?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no I think I think it's, it's the, you know it's the good kind of stress. It's um, it's good work.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Well <UNIN/> if there's anything you want to talk to me about, you can always come see me about your mood, um stress, anxiety. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> happy to help.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I don't know. I, I like my job. It's just you know, it's a bit more work than usual.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. OK. And just very briefly, just in terms of smoking uh, do you smoke at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah occasionally, you know, cigars and things on company parties.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK so not, not regular. Um and what about alcohol?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, occasionally yeah I would have some. I'm, I'm not a very big drinker.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> socially with work.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um OK. Um so um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> just having listened to your story, um uh really just to summarize you know since the last four days you've been feeling generally quite unwell, sore throat, runny nose, bit of a dry cough, bit of muscle pain, weakness.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um had initial fever, but now settled. Um I don't think there's a lot to worry about. I think you probably have, you know a bit of a viral, what we say viral illness, maybe a viral upper respiratory tract infection, or maybe early signs of a flu.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um these normally last about seven to days and just gets better really, um over time. But things you can do to really help yourself, um is get plenty of rest. I'd probably advise you taking a day or two off work if you can. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Making yourself, <UNIN/> pushing fluids and make yourself well-hydrated. Continue with the regular Paracetamol, Ibuprofen. Um and and you should see how things go, really. Um if next week you're still not better, I'd like you to come back and see me.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um is that clear? Does that, does that make, does that make <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, that's that's <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, it makes sense. Uh, I think <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> I'll take a couple days off, and see how it goes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, <UNSURE>yeah</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> and things to look out for if you're really not getting better, if you if you have a high fever, or your breathing is becoming a bit more labored, or chest pain, I'd like you to come back and see me much sooner, give me a call. Um and <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> we can help you out. OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah I understand. Uh, I'll uh, I'll take care.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Great. Have a great day. Good luck with your work. Thank you. <UNSURE>Bye bye. Bye bye.</UNSURE>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Thank you. Thank you. You too. Bye bye.
